citation.title: P5-S2.01 Survey on knowledge, attitude and practices on male circumcision in Rwanda

blogs.title: Cultural constraints on the uptake of voluntary medical male circumcision in Eastern and Southern Africa
blogs.summary: My previous blog spoke of the recent PLoS-Medicine Collection on the progress of a UNAIDS initiative for a five-year scale-up of Voluntary Male Medical Circumcision (VMMC) for HIV prevention in 14 high priority Eastern and Southern African countries.

blogs.title: Feasibility of infant circumcision as an HIV prevention tool
blogs.summary: Recent trials have shown male circumcision (MC) to be associated with a reduced HIV incidence of up to 60%. For this reason UNAIDS has included ambitious goals for circumcision (20 millions MCs) as a major component of its HIV prevention strategies for 14

blogs.title: Location of HIV-2 emergence determined by distribution of indigenous cultural practices of male circumcision
